page.title: 03Public House Litlington
page.content: The Plough and Harrow public house in the village of Litlington has been selling beer since the year 1700. Much of today's trade includes the sale of hot and cold meals,both at mid-day and each evening.An old tradition has been revived because the present landlord serves real ale as in olden times using hand pumps.He serves 5000 meals each month and on occasions even more. Once a year a marathon race in aid of charity is run from Eastbourne.This involves about 3000 people and many stop at Litlington's pub for their refreshment - a chaotic but memorable day for the publican.He has made a dining car as on a railway train and people visit the pub to share this railway interest.There is a darts team which provides lighthearted fun for local people and visiting competitors. A jolly,well patronised place.
